page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY -THE HERMIT.
page.content: {Job}was born an illegitimate,in{Ilkley {in 1777,}and died in{1853 aged 83.}He worked on the moors looking after cattle, dry stone walling and was a general handyman. He was able to sing in four octives and would sing in pubs for beer. When he was older he married a widow 20 years his elder called{Mary {Barret,}and hoped to claim her money when she died.{Mary}had a sore throat, so{Job}lit a fire a roasted some pork over it. He then poured the fat down Mary's throat to try and cure her, but it scolded her to death instead.{Job went out and on his return found Mary's family had taken everything. He built a little shack from the ruins at {Robin Hole}and lived there for{23yrs } living mainly on potatoes.{Job}went out one night to{Blubberhouses}were someone spiked his drink and he died. {Job}is buried in{St.Maries Church.}
